channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A black leather sofa has been dumped on the pavement of Crescent Road close to the junction of East Barnet Road, 14th August
item.description:
A sofa has been on Crescent Road for about a week

item.title: Obscured/damaged road sign, Princes Circus, 14th August
item.description:
The directional sign here is damaged (split in half) and most of the sign is illegible as it has been covered in stickers. Located on Shaftesbury Avenue, just south of the junction with St Giles High Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shaftesbury Avenue, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exposed wiring on sign, 14th August
item.description:
The no entry illuminated sign here has a loose access panel and has exposed wiring. Located on Wardour Street, at the junction with Oxford Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180, Wardour Street, Camden Town, London

item.title: 3 divan beds dumped, 14th August

item.title: Gipsy Hill SE19 on the opposite side of the road to, 13th August
item.description:
Gipsy Hill SE19 on the opposite side of the road to number 138 black Lambeth pavement litter bin tagged per picture. (Bin on Lambeth side of the road ‚Äì 138 is on Southwark side just to be clear.) Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4250294,-0.0837082,3a,75y,256.66h,70.69t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sSZqgdJj8lROZqeOMqWwaCQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D19.310000000000002%26panoid%3DSZqgdJj8lROZqeOMqWwaCQ%26yaw%3D256.66!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDgxMS4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gipsy Hill, London

item.title: Leigham Court Road SW16 / Valley Road / K, 13th August
item.description:
Leigham Court Road SW16 / Valley Road / Knolly‚Äôs Road junction a number of polycarbonate flyposter boards attached to traffic light poles with plastic zip ties ‚Äì mainly for ‚ÄúCarnival Warm Up‚Äù ‚Äì white and red boards.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pain all over pavement down the road., 13th August
item.description:
Hi, Senrab Street recently got resurfaced. The actual surfacing is to a good standard. This was also done quickly. What i can't understand at all is the total mess on the payments of left over paint and words such as 'KEEP CLEAR' and 'SCHOOL' etc fully left over. Ive tried to take some photos but it makes both sides of the pavement look a total mess. Why wasnt this done in chalk? Why actual paint. It's honestly a complete mess to an otherwise lovely road.

Report on FixMyStreet
